channel.title: open source on Schulich Ignite
channel.description: Recent content in open source on Schulich Ignite

item.title: We Have AI at Home
item.description: AI has hit the world hard in the last few years. Particularly with the introduction of newer generative AI systems like LLM’s (Large language models like ChatGPT, Bard, Llama), and image generators (like Midjourney, DALL-E-2, Imagen etc.

item.title: Building a Good Github profile
item.description: So, you’ve signed up for github, but your profile looks incredibly bland. How do you go about improving it? Why bother?

item.title: Intro to Github
item.description: In the last article we covered git and using it. We talked a bit about remotes, which are services that allow you to use git over the internet.

item.title: Intro to Git
item.description: In the last article we looked at version control systems. We looked at a very manual way of building one out with file folders, and noticed a few issues with our approach:

item.title: Intro to VCS's
item.description: Things change fast, and keeping track of those changes is not an easy task. Version control systems are built to help manage versions of software, and software changes.

item.title: Stealing Like a Developer
item.description: No one writes all their own code. We always build on the shoulders of the people that came before us. But how do we do this responsibly, and legally?
